intro: Lychnis flos-cuculi f. nana, commonly known as the dwarf white campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a compact, herbaceous perennial that produces delicate, five-petaled white flowers with a distinctive red or purple center. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few inches, making it ideal for rock gardens or small spaces. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its foliage consists of oval, serrated leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white绒毛, giving it a soft, woolly appearance.
